Document.TEXT: Global Xenon Gas Market - Market Research Report 2015-2019 By PR Newswire Article Rating: January 7, 2016 05:06 PM EST LONDON , Jan. 7, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- About xenon gas Xenon is naturally available in the atmosphere in trace amounts and is extremely expensive to produce. Xenon is commercially extracted through atmospheric air distillation while some of its compounds are sourced from certain igneous rocks and hot springs. With about eight stable isotopes and more than 40 unstable isotopes, the gas, despite the limited availability and high price, is used for certain exclusive applications some of which are listed as follows: - Used in high resolution IMAX screens and projector screens, where xenon arc lamps act as an excellent source of short wavelength UV radiation - Forms a range of chemical compounds such as xenon chloride and xenon fluoride that are widely used in excimer lasers - Used as an efficient alternate anesthetic to nitrous oxide; it is also used as a performance stimulant by athletes Technavio's analysts forecast the global xenon gas market to grow at a CAGR of 6.12% over the period 2014-2019.
